function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Unbalanced panels in the data due to different start dates for testing for COVID-19 in localities","Impact":"Inaccurate or biased estimation of the effects of policy variables on infection rates","Mitigation":"Use statistical techniques to handle unbalanced panels such as fixed effects models or cluster-robust standard errors","Technologies":"Statistical software for panel data analysis","People":"Data analysts, statisticians","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies"},{"Description":"Dependence on the assumption of constant exponential growth in early infection rates","Impact":"Misleading estimation results due to violation of the assumption","Mitigation":"Consider alternative models that account for non-exponential growth, such as logistic growth models","Technologies":"Advanced epidemiological modeling software","People":"Epidemiologists, modelers","Owner":"Health organizations, research institutions"},{"Description":"Conditional independence assumption between policy deployments and infection growth rates may not hold in real-world contexts","Impact":"Invalidation of estimation results and causal inferences","Mitigation":"Conduct sensitivity analyses to assess the robustness of results to violations of the conditional independence assumption","Technologies":"Statistical software for sensitivity analysis","People":"Data analysts, statisticians","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies"}]}
